# Simony

**SIM'ONY**, _noun_ \[from Simon Magus, who wished to purchase the power of conferring the Holy Spirit. [[Acts 8#1|Acts 8:1]]\] The crime of buying or selling ecclesiastical preferment; or the corrupt presentation of any one to an ecclesiastical benefice of money or reward. By Stat. 31 Elizabeth, c. 6. severe penalties are enacted against this crime.

**SIMOOM'**, _noun_ A hot suffocating wind, that blows occasionally in Africa and Arabia, generated by the extreme heat of the parched deserts or sandy plains. Its approach is indicated by a redness in the air, and its fatal effects are to be avoided by falling on the face and holding the breath.
